comments.commentBody: How about a fair equal tax rate for all entities (people, churches, corporations, everything, etc)?  We all use roads, bridges, protective services plus this would eliminate the states courting corporations with free tax opportunities and raising tax burden on the lower/middle class.  Demand shared sacrifices and equal fair taxes for all!  Why is this not a national dialog with your audience and among our government officials?

In as weak an economy as we are currently experiencing, inflation is a serious worry for only the wealthy, for whom it threatens the return on their investments. Most Americans would be happy to see a small to moderate spike in inflation if it meant shaving a significant amount off the unemployment rate. When you hear political leaders obsessing over inflation when unemployment is pushing 10%, you know their concern is NOT for the middle class voters in their districts.

The Fed is coming to grips with a very inconvenient convergence of poor prospects in both public finance and demographics.

We have very high deficits. At the same time, we need (at the individual level) to save more -- A LOT MORE -- to finance retirement and health care costs for the Boomers (who, due largely to obesity rates, run the distinct risk of being SICKER as they age than the preceeding generation!)

These undeniable facts mean that we CANNOT artificialy inflate current consumption (and hence employment) to pre-2008 levels, no matter HOW hard the Fed now tries.

If we had started saving earlier, instead of allowing our personal savings rate to fall to ZERO, the pressure would not be so bad.

Similarly, if we had done a better job setting aside revenue for public entitlement programs that the Boomers were promised, we would not be so far in the hole. It was easy to see it coming, but we allowed ourselves to indulge in "Enron" style accounting gimmicks to avoid the unwanted tax burdens.

SO now we are reaping the consequences of years of self-indulgence (on the personal level) and careless, overly optimistic assumptions in the public finance arena.

Folks, Kruschev was wrong. The Soviet Union didn't bury us.

We dug our own grave.

Mr. Leonhardt is ignoring the fact that long-term interest rates are currently at or near historic lows.
Do you really think that the Fed acting to reduce rates any further is going to reduce unemployment?

This is a case of building a story around a concept with no foundation.

The first Western boots are on the ground, soon to be follow by hundreds if not thousands of military trainers, then, gradually or suddenly, thousands of regular troops.
A new Crusade and colonial invasion, confirming what Gaddafi said was going to happen?
The problem, before Western intervention: Too many penniless and jobless hungry people in Libya, North Africa, the Middle East, and elsewhere -- and getting worse.
Democracy as we know it will fail in these states. Only a communist Chinese-st­yle free enterprise government might work, but only if a strong benevolent dictator with a strongly enforced one-child per family law is in control for a few decades and able to suppress religious zealots. Otherwise, perpetual civil war is inevitable­.

The hilarious implication is that somehow this is a special instance where we have people/agents "in the field". The US presumably has agents everywhere -- I mean, what sort of intelligence would the CIA be if it didn't have agents throughout all the oil-producing countries' governments.

Obviously, this is a not-so-subtle PR message to Qadaffi that the gloves are off for good and he'd better get out while the getting is still somewhat good.

The same crew who worked with Mubarak to kidnap and torture people?

Seriously. The CIA exists to destroy the democratic aspirations of people who's national sovereignty might (maybe, in some outlandish universe) get in the way of "our national interest." Since the American people apparently get no say in what, exactly, that national interest it: I wish the people of the Arab world good luck in identifying those CIA agents and bringing them to justice. Like the assassin recently caught in Pakistan, and the many others.

Maybe they should also report their names with SSNs, and what they are doing and where in Libya. With recent photos.

Is this really the way we are supposed to be operating now?

The CIA involved extrajudicialy in a dirty war in the middle east? I'm shocked...shocked i tell you. I must have missed that part and the arming the rebels part and the secret findings part in the UN mandate.

To SamR #60.
The US does many wrong things, most of them not desired by the American public but apparently rammed through by whoever it is that runs the country. Even at that, the US is NOTHING like the bloody regimes all over the world that throw people behind bars for the slightest dissent. If you think things are so wonderful elsewhere, you ought to travel. . . and then pick out the "great country" you think is so much better than ours. And emigrate. After traveling in 5 continents and loving what I experienced, there's still no place like America, even with all its blemishes.

The issue in these comments is -- what do we think about the CIA presence in Libya, and should we vigorously protest what our government is doing? I think we should protest before things escalate. We can't afford this Libyan "adventure," for many reasons. Time for the government to yield to the public will.

Artificial food dyes are also found in children's and adult vitamins, shampoos and even medicines. What possible reason are they put in prescription drugs except to make them bright colors. These dyes are also responsible for allergic reactions. My doctors concluded that I had such a reaction to either blue or red dyes causing swelling in the groin after consuming them in a cheap birthday cake and then my scalp absorbing through contact with a shampoo. They really need objective study and regulation -- especially in medicines where there are often no alternatives.

To #23 "DD"" Gorbachev, born in 1931, was 25 years old in 1956 and in no position to send in "massive amounts of troops". Get your facts straight. The world is complicated enough, we don't need disinformation to further muddy the playing field.

I happen to agree that we, the US, did a major disservice to Hungary at that time, but don't blame Gorbachev for any of that. He was one of the few enlightened world leaders of the 20th. century and deserves better than that.
CIA agents, arms to rebels, special ops forces, all in support of a no-fly zone.  I can't tell where Bush left off and Obama begins.

Give the woman a break.  There is more to life than politics.  Her so-called friends should quit pushing her political career and allow her the time to fully heal.  And with their terrible border problems, the citizens of Arizona need a Representative who can devote full-time to the job

I was pleased but not really surprised to learn that in Europe, where I'm currently living, it's standard practice not to use artificial coloring. They get the same effect -- well, the colors are maybe slightly muted -- from using additives made from plants, flowers, and other natural, non-animal products. Living abroad has proved a relief from my family's vigilant avoidance of artificial coloring in the U.S., especially difficult in the case of children's food which is larded with such additions. Perhaps scientific studies, for a variety of reasons, have not definitively proved a link between hyperactivity and these additives, but my daughter certainly has! She doesn't even like food with what she calls "artificial" because she feels strange when she eats it, and has trouble controlling her behavior and emotions.

I doubt that anyone who suffers a brain injury as serious as Gabrielle Giffords would quickly relearn basic tasks in time to make the race. In fact, I'm pretty doubtful that she will be able to live independently again.
Look at what happened to James Brady.
Leave her alone. The fact is this country will not change one iota whatever her political future. I hope she and evry other victim makes a full recovery as soon as possible.

To say that the old Case is back, showing U.S. his misinterpretations of facts, would be redundant. He never left.

IF you accept The Case's premise, that if only one wage earner loses their job, the other(s) can "carry on" as if nothing happened; then you too must believe that when child support stops, absolutely nothing will happen to the children. And, you must also buy into Case's unstated argument that when a single mother loses her job, she is economically able and morally required to continue on raising her children with all the wonderful benefits of child support and/or unemployment.

As we all know, bcuz The Case tells U.S. that it is so, when women entered the workforce, ALL of that additional income was NOT used by the families to cover expense, bcuz is wasn't needed for that. So, they saved it. In Case doesn't show U.S. that "savings" have substantially increased as women went to work, why don't we all just assume, like he does, that he knows what he is talking about.

Intelligence gathering and overseas operations are not black and white. There are extenuating circumstances behind every move, that's why we have a Secretary of State and Congressional Committees to oversee the operations and make decisions. You will notice that this is one area where bipartisanship usually takes place because anyone involved knows that this is complicated. (Except for has beens like Newt who know better but can't resist the temptation to second guess).

Syria, Yemen, Saudi Arabia, Lebanon, Egypt all present different problems and different approaches. I hope that Obama does not get re-elected but in the meantime I also hope that he makes the right decisions since the Middle East is in a very critical state.

Air Power with target painting by teams on the ground completely defeated the Taliban in short order when they controlled Afghanistan and this method can do the same in Libya..

This myth by ignorant pundits that our array of Air Power and Cruise Missiles cannot defeat ground forces is a lie..as we will soon see again..

So why are we wasting $2.8 Billion per week and forcing our troops to run around or become easy targets left in desolate regions in Afghanistan..?

Unfortunately, the real problem is there are lots of places where there is no internet access to your music.
And my experience here in CA that is very common if you're not at home and cell phone service is always iffy at best
A bit too soon I think for anyone to consider her fit to run. The brain is vital, obviously, and she needs time.

Let us hope she recovers completely and enjoys every well earned minute of her life while inspiring another capable person to pick up the mantle. This would be too much pressure on anyone who has been wounded so gravely . . .

Here is a budget cut. fire all 354 of the morons on capital hill. thats a 65 million dollar savings since they cant do their job and pass a budget. Clearly they are the lazy government employees that everyone complains about.

Joe (#3)--it's still too early, but there are many good candidates.

The good news for Obama is that he finally has experience...but that is also the bad news for him too.

My short list is Perry, Trump, Daniels, Kyle, Paul.
Christie, Ryan, Rubio, Sandoval are the face of the future.
